title: Watch R.E.M.’s Michael Stipe Perform With Jason Isbell at Kamala Harris Event in Pittsburgh
description: The musicians supported the Democratic presidential candidate with renditions of “The One I Love,” “Driver 8,” and more
author: Matthew Strauss
excerpt: The musicians supported the Democratic presidential candidate with renditions of “The One I Love,” “Driver 8,” and more
text: The musicians supported the Democratic presidential candidate with renditions of “The One I Love,” “Driver 8,” and moreOn Friday night (October 4), R.E.M. frontman Michael Stipe and Jason Isbell played a Pittsburgh rally in support of Democrats Kamala Harris and Tim Walz. After being introduced by the vice president’s husband, Doug Emhoff, they played R.E.M.’s “The One I Love” and “Driver 8” and Isbell’s “Traveling Alone” and “Hope the High Road.” Watch footage of the performance below. Plus, head to Instagram to watch Stipe and Isbell in conversation with Emhoff.Earlier this year, in August, Isbell performed at the Democratic National Convention in Chicago.The 2024 U.S. elections are on Tuesday, November 5. html:
The musicians supported the Democratic presidential candidate with renditions of “The One I Love,” “Driver 8,” and more

On Friday night (October 4), R.E.M. frontman Michael Stipe and Jason Isbell played a Pittsburgh rally in support of Democrats Kamala Harris and Tim Walz. After being introduced by the vice president’s husband, Doug Emhoff, they played R.E.M.’s “The One I Love” and “Driver 8” and Isbell’s “Traveling Alone” and “Hope the High Road.” Watch footage of the performance below. Plus, head to Instagram to watch Stipe and Isbell in conversation with Emhoff.

Earlier this year, in August, Isbell performed at the Democratic National Convention in Chicago.

The 2024 U.S. elections are on Tuesday, November 5. Make your plan to vote at https://weall.vote/pitchfork.

Matthew Strauss is a Long Island native and a graduate of Columbia University. He joined Pitchfork in 2013.
